Description: A large collection of small shell disc beads at present strung as a fillet or girdle of eighteen rows.
Curator's comments: According to Brunton (‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 118), the grave was very plundered and there is no mention of such a beadwork belt. Also from this burial: beads (1930,0711.281 & 1930,0711.282 & 1930,0711.283 & 1930,0711.284 & 1930,0711.285 & 1930,0711.286 & 1930,0711.287 & 1930,0711.289 & 1930,0711.290 & 1930,0711.291), ear-ring (1930,0711.293), shells (1930,0711.288). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 118; pl. LXXI; Bead register, pl. LXXIA.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (609)
